frameDefinitions: A Whole, an entity with a substructure, is assessed for whether or not it has all the necessary parts that are defined for it or for an entity of its kind.
This frame describes the Impression which a Figure, which can be a person, an organization, or an object, leaves with an Audience.
This frames describes a social event where there may or may not be a permanent or semi-permanent relationship between participants.
This frame contains nouns that refer to sensations in different modalities.
An Entity changes from a Prior_state to a Post_state in a sequence that follows a pre-defined plan, expectation, or model of change.
A perceptible Figure shows up against a Ground location due to Light shining on/from it, its salience possibly dependent on a Cause_of_shine.
frameExamples: What happens after the PPB investigation is <t>complete</t>?
He had an extremely fragile self - <t><fex name='Impression'>image</fex></t>
Our <t>date</t> yesterday was interrupted by my ex-boyfriend!
The huge sand dunes, perpetually changing, make for a surreal <t>sight</t>.
Their offensive armament has <t>developed</t> from short range missiles to long-range ballistic weaponry in a relatively short period .
listRoleDefinitions: The entity that is being assessed for having all its necessary parts or not.
The interval of time when the completeness of the entity is assessed.
The entity (a person, organization, product, or event) for which the <fen>Audience</fen> has an <fen>Impression</fen>.
A person or group of people who have an <fen>Impression</fen> of a <fen>Figure</fen>.
A generalized conception of a <fen>Figure</fen> presented to or shared by an <fen>Audience</fen>.
The <fen>Attendees</fen> are the collectively construed participants of the social event.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the social event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the social event occurs.
This role is only expressed with certain nouns in this frame, and then only with the help of a support verb, such as <ment>have</ment>:

This is the entity or phenomenon which gives rise to the sensation. In cases of veridical sensation, this role is not typically distinguished from <fen>Percept</fen>. Most of the phrases that express this role can be paraphrased as <ment>from</ment>-phrases, e.g.

The role <fen>Percept</fen> is used for phrases that express the characteristic property of a sensation. Typically this characteristic property is described with reference to the entity or phenomenon that produces the sensation---that  is why this role can be difficult to distinguish from Source. It is possible for Source and Percept to be expressed separately, however:

This role is assigned to phrases expressing the body part in which a sensation is located. Since touch is the least localized of sense modalities, words relating to haptic sensations are the ones most likely to occur with this FE:
This role is the perceptual background against which the Phenomenon is experienced by the Perceiver.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the sensation is perceived.
The object that undergoes change.
The time at which the progress occurs.
The location where the Progress occurs.
The percept which is perceived at a certain <fen>Ground</fen> location.
The location of the phenomenon.
The <fen>Light</fen> which is emitted.  In this frame, it is usually incorporated in verbs and adjectives, and is the denotation of many of the nouns.
The <fen>Time</fen> when the <fen>Figure</fen> is observed against the <fen>Ground</fen> location due to <fen>Light</fen> shining on it.
The spatial setting in which the <fen>Figure</fen> shows up against a <fen>Ground</fen> location.
listRoleExamples: <fex>Our list of participants</fex> is still incomplete.
My journey to the dark side is <fex>now</fex> complete.
<fex>I</fex> have a tingling sensation in my hands.
The smell <fex>of the garlic</fex> made me hungry.
This herb gives off a smell <fex>of garlic</fex>.
I have a tingling feeling <fex>in my hands</fex>.
Advances <fex>in marketing techniques</fex> have since rendered it obsolete.
<fex>When</fex> did the X-wing progress beyond the drawing board?
Hot coals glowed <fex>behind the fire grate</fex>.
<fex>In the morning</fex> the grass glistened with dew
<fex>Outside</fex> something was shimmering on the shore.
